topic_metadata.title: Why existing templates can no longer pass compilation now？

posts.name: daoshi1593
posts.cooked:
Actually, a few months ago I used a certain template to write an article, which could correctly compile and generate a PDF file at that time. Now when I try to compile it again, I found it fails. I’ve also noticed that many templates no longer compile successfully (they should have worked properly before). I want to know why this is happening and how I can fix it?

image1555×927 92.4 KB

this is a picture about errors
posts.raw:
Actually, a few months ago I used a certain template to write an article, which could correctly compile and generate a PDF file at that time. Now when I try to compile it again, I found it fails. I've also noticed that many templates no longer compile successfully (they should have worked properly before). I want to know why this is happening and how I can fix it?
![image|690x411](upload://1pHcIpt2aiKbFh2bmyRpAMKRttc.png)
this is a picture about errors

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked:
Hello, which version of touying are you using? You might need to upgrade the version.

See How to use context instead of a callback function in locate function calls?
posts.raw:
Hello, which version of touying are you using? You might need to upgrade the version.

See https://forum.typst.app/t/how-to-use-context-instead-of-a-callback-function-in-locate-function-calls/965

posts.name: daoshi1593
posts.cooked:
0.4.0. These templates that don’t work now were probably developed under older versions, so could this be because the Touyin version is outdated? I think perhaps I should downgrade to an earlier Typst version, but I haven’t found the Linux command to do this.
thanks for your replying.
posts.raw:
0.4.0. These templates that don't work now were probably developed under older versions, so could this be because the Touyin version is outdated? I think perhaps I should downgrade to an earlier Typst version, but I haven't found the Linux command to do this.
thanks for your replying.

posts.name: Pascal Quach
posts.cooked: You can always download releases of Typst at Releases · typst/typst · GitHub and change the version from the webapp project settings.
posts.raw: You can always download releases of Typst at https://github.com/typst/typst/releases and change the version from the webapp project settings.

posts.name: daoshi1593
posts.cooked: Thank you very much for your reply. Previously, I wasn’t familiar with version settings for web applications.
posts.raw: Thank you very much for your reply. Previously, I wasn't familiar with version settings for web applications.
